intro: Fridericia lauta, commonly known as the roughleaf fridericia, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits are capsules that contain small, hairy seeds. Fridericia lauta is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in pine flatwoods.
